title.text: Support Vector Machines Applied to the Classification of Semantic Relations in Nominalized Noun Phrases

entities.text: Classification of Semantic Relations in Nominalized Noun Phrases

abstractContent.text: The discovery of semantic relations in text plays an important role in many NLP applications.
This paper presents a method for the automatic classification of semantic relations in nominalized noun phrases.

entities.text: automatic classification of semantic relations in nominalized noun phrases

abstractContent.text: Nominalizations represent a subclass of NP constructions in which either the head or the modifier noun is derived from a verb while the other noun is an argument of this verb.
Especially designed features are extracted automatically and used in a Support Vector Machine learning model.
The paper presents preliminary results for the semantic classification of the most representative NP patterns using four distinct learning models .
